thread.title: Chelsea captain John Terry sent off on return from injury after foul on Peterborough’s Lee Angol
thread.title_full: Chelsea captain John Terry sent off on return from injury after foul on Peterborough’s Lee Angol

author: irishmirror
title: Chelsea captain John Terry sent off on return from injury after foul on Peterborough’s Lee Angol
text:
Sport Chelsea captain John Terry sent off on return from injury after foul on Peterborough’s Lee Angol The 36-year-old was shown a straight red card for a foul Peterborough’s Lee Angol, who was through on goal Share Chelsea's John Terry looks dejected after being shown a red card (Photo: Reuters) Share   
John Terry made his first appearance in over two months on Sunday when Chelsea took on Peterborough in the FA Cup third round. 
Unfortunately for the Blues skipper, making his 50th start for the Blues in the competition, he lasted just 67 minutes before heading for an early bath. 
The 36-year-old was shown a straight red card for a foul Peterborough’s Lee Angol, falling over in front of the 22-year-old striker who was through on goal. 
Making matters worse, Chelsea were up 3-0 at the time leaving any such risk as uneccessary. Terry after being shown a red card by referee Kevin Friend (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Terry returned to Chelsea training late last month following a muscle injury that had kept him out since the 5-0 win over Everton in November. 
The former England international — whose last start for Chelsea came in the EFL Cup loss West Ham in October — will now face a ban. 
Blues boss Antonio Conte talked up Terry's fitness before Sunday's comeback. 
Conte said. "John is in a good shape and he’s ready to play. He’s doing great work on the pitch and outside the pitch. It’s important to underline this." 
Terry started at the back with Gary Cahill and Kurt Zouma, Like us on Facebook
